It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1799 Feb. 12, Knoxville, Tennessee [to] Richard Harrison, Philadelphia, Penn. / David Henley
bibl.author: Henley, David
bibl.note: This document is a brief letter dated February 12, 1799 from David Henley to Richard Harrison. The subject of the letter is furnishings for the Indian and Quarter Masters Departments.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p: I have forwarded the accounts of King & Crozier for sundry articles of merchandise furnished for the Indian and Quarter masters Departments, and for the use of my office from april to December 1798, and amounting to four hundred fifty one dollars and ninety nine cents, which sum they request may be paid to their attorney Mr Mister . Samuel Meeker__
div.closer:
I am respectfully Your Humbl Humble . Servant David Henley
agt agent war
Richard Harrison esquire__
Knoxville
Feby February 12 1799
David Henley with Accots Accounts of King & Crozier
Richard Harrison esquire United States Auditor Philadelphia
